Name:
Wessex
SAS Jan van Riebeeck
Builder: Fairfield Shipbuilding and Engineering Company, Govan
Fate:
Sold to South African Navy, 29 March 1950
Sunk as target, 25 March 1980
Displacement:
1,710 long tons (1,740 t) (standard load)
2,530 long tons (2,570 t) (deep load)
Range: 4,675 nmi (8,658 km; 5,380 mi) at 20 knots (37 km/h; 23 mph)
processing systems:
ASDIC
Type 272 surface-search radar
Type 282 and 285 gunnery radars
Type 291 early-warning radar
Armament:
4 × single 4.7-inch (120 mm) guns
1 × quadruple 2-pounder (40 mm) "pom-pom" AA gun
4 × twin Oerlikon 20 mm (0.8 in) AA guns
2 × quadruple 21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes
70 depth charges; 4 throwers, 2 rails
